weapons: Martial melee weapons that have the Finesse or Light property

entries: {@i Choose A or B:} (A) {@item  Leather Armor|XPHB}, 5 {@item Dagger|XPHB}, {@item Shortsword|XPHB}, {@item Weaver's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Explorer's Pack|XPHB}, and 9 GP; or (B) 50 GP
I knew the wish, and the price to achieve it. And now, across these many ages, I have only come to know it better...
Strength... in mind, in care, in claw. Strength enough that I may live to see a world better than our own, or to craft a world as I desire.

entries.name: A Desire for Domination
entries: Weavers are vicious beings, seeking mainly to spin their webs and enthrall others. Some Weavers, however, rise above this purpose, seeking to use their powers for good. Whether it be as simple as running errands or complex as slaying gods, these benevolent Weavers are often sought after for their speed and skill in combat.

entries.name: Creating a Weaver
entries: As you build your Weaver, think about the origin of their abilities. Were they born into a family or society of Weavers? Were they taken in by another benevolent being and taught the importance of the greater good? From where did they develop their skills in combat?

Tools are an essential part of playing as a Weaver. While each subclass only has access to a few tool slots, there are numerous combinations that can augment your abilities in and out of combat. These tools can also be swapped during a Long Rest.

Your primary abilities for this class are Dexterity and Intelligence. While some subclasses and Tools focus more on the Intelligence stat, your primary resource, Silk, is only generated through melee combat. You will need to excel in this to be able to use your other abilities to their full potential

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: First, your highest ability score should be Dexterity, followed by Intelligence and then Constitution. The Artisan or Wayfarer backgrounds are recommended for their ability score bonuses and thematic Origin Feats.

classFeature.name: Bind
entries: You have the ability to bind Silk to your body in order to heal your wounds. As an Action, you can spend 5 Silk Spools to bind your wounds with Silk, regaining Hit Points equal to {@dice 1d10} + your Weaver level. You may only Bind once per turn.

classFeature.name: Needle
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can bind to a weapon with which you have proficiency. That chosen weapon becomes your Needle. Only one weapon can function as your Needle at a time. Binding to another weapon will remove your bond to your current Needle.
While you are bound to a Needle, you gain the following abilities:

entries.name: Eye of the Needle
entries: You have a knack for striking an enemy's weak points. The first time you land an attack with your Needle on your turn, you deal an additional {@dice 1d4} damage of the weapon's damage type.

entries.name: Perfect Parry
entries: You can use your Needle defensively. When an enemy hits you with an attack, you can use your Reaction to make an attack roll using your Needle. If you tie or exceed enemy's attack roll, you negate the incoming attack, though you deal no damage in return. You cannot parry a Critical Hit with this feature.

classFeature.name: Silk
entries: Your connection to your ancestors allows you to generate and bind Silk. Your ability to gather and make use of this energy is represented by a number of Silk Spools. Your Weaver level determines the maximum number of Silk Spools you can have, as shown in the Weaver table.
You can spend these points to fuel various Silk Skills. You start knowing one such feature: Bind

entries.name: Gaining Silk
entries: You gain Silk by successfully striking a "hostile" creature with your Needle. (Whether a creature is "hostile" is determined by your DM.) Doing so restores 1 Silk Spool. Additionally, all of your Silk Spools are restored whenever your character level increases.

entries.name: Optional: Ancient Wonders
entries: Your DM may allow you to find silk stores, hot springs, or other ancient wonders throughout the world that can replenish your Silk stores.

entries.name: Silk Skills
entries: As you gain levels in this class, you will learn Silk Skills. Intelligence is your Silk Skill ability due to the craftiness required to use it to its full potential. You use your Intelligence modifier whenever a feature refers to your Silk modifier. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for an Item or Silk feature you use and when making an attack roll with one.
Silk Skills are considered to be spells in reference to other game mechanics. Additionally, the effects of Blue and Yellow Tools are suspended if you are raging or in an {@spell antimagic field}.

classFeature.name: Swift Step
entries: You gain the following benefits if you aren't wearing Medium or Heavy Armor or using a Shield:

items: Your movement speed increases by 5 feet. Additionally, you can use a Bonus Action to rush up to 10 feet in any direction.
When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your Reaction to take no damage on a success rather than half damage.
You can determine your jump distance using your Dexterity rather than your Strength

classFeature.name: Silk Skills
entries: You have discovered a method of using silk to augment your abilities. Starting at 3rd level, you may use Silk Spools to cast powerful {@filter Silk Skills|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Silk Skill}. Pick 3 abilities to unlock now. You learn an additional Silk Skill at 7th, 11th, and 15th level. You can swap known Silk Skills in your Crest when you take a Long Rest.

classFeature.name: Tools
entries: You have mastered the ability to craft Tools for offense and defense. You can now equip Tools as listed in the table for each respective Crest. You can swap your equipped Tools during a Long Rest, and all Tool uses are restored at the end of a Long Rest.

classFeature.name: Weaver Subclass
entries: You have learned to focus your power through specialized crests. There are 7 Crests to choose from, with each one focusing on a unique fighting style: Hunter, Reaper, Wanderer, Beast, Witch, Architect, and Shaman.
While these Crests function as traditional subclasses, they differ in that you can swap your Crest during a Long Rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat (chapter 5 of the PHB) or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Weaver levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Silk Heart
entries: You learn how to produce Silk on your own. When you start your turn with fewer Silk Spools than Silk Hearts, you can add 1 Silk Spool to a maximum of 1 (no action required). You gain an additional Silk Heart at Weaver level 8 and 12. You can also see your maximum Silk Hearts in the Silk Heart column of the Weaver Features table.

classFeature.name: Drifter's Cloak
entries: You have modified your clothing to improve your mobility. When you make a standing or running long jump, you can double the distance.

As a Reaction, you can gain the effects of the {@spell feather fall} spell, but only on yourself. You can choose to cancel these effects at any time (no action required) rather than waiting the full duration of the spell.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Weaver Crest

classFeature.name: Vesticrest (Yellow)
entries: You gain a permanent Yellow tool slot regardless of your current equipped Crest.

classFeature.name: Claw Grip
entries: You gain a Climb Speed equal to your Speed. You have advantage on ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb a surface with few handholds.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat (chapter 5 of the PHB) or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Silk Heart
entries: You learn how to produce Silk on your own. When you start your turn with fewer Silk Spools than Silk Hearts, you can add 1 Silk Spool to a maximum of 1 (no action required). You can also see your maximum Silk Hearts in the Silk Heart column of the Weaver Features table.

classFeature.name: Clawline
entries: You can replace one of the attacks from the Attack action to spend 1 Silk Spool to latch onto an enemy or surface up to 15 feet away, pulling yourself towards them in the process. If you latch onto an enemy in this way, you can make a Needle attack. This attack does an additional {@dice 1d6} damage and recovers Silk as normal.
When attacking a Huge or larger creature with this feature, you gain 2 Silk Spools instead.

classFeature.name: Needolin
entries: You gain proficiency with a musical instrument and proficiency in ({@skill Performance}) checks (or another skill of your choice if you already have proficiency in Performance). The instrument you choose counts as your Needolin for all related features.
While playing your Needolin, you can read the surface thoughts of others similar to the {@spell Detect Thoughts} spell. You can also spend 1 Silk Spool to cast the {@spell Speak with Dead} spell.

As a Magic Action on your turn, you can spend 1 Silk Spool to cast the {@spell Hold Monster} spell. However, you must continue playing the Needolin as a Magic action on subsequent turns to maintain Concentration on the spell. Your movement speed is 0 and you cannot take any Bonus Action or Reaction while playing the Needolin in this way.

classFeature.name: Faydown Cloak
entries: You gain resistance to Cold damage and a Fly Speed of 30 feet. You fall to the ground if you end your turn while in the air, although you can negate any fall damage by activating your Drifter's Cloak.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Weaver Crest

classFeature.name: Vesticrest (Blue)
entries: You gain a permanent Blue tool slot regardless of which crest you have equipped.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat (chapter 5 of the PHB) or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Silk Heart
entries: You learn how to produce Silk on your own. When you start your turn with fewer Silk Spools than Silk Hearts, you can add 1 Silk Spool to a maximum of 1 (no action required). You can also see your maximum Silk Hearts in the Silk Heart column of the Weaver Features table.

classFeature.name: Beastling Call
entries: You have learned a new use for your Needolin. You can spend 1 Silk Spool and a minute to cast the {@spell Transport via Plants} spell while playing your Needolin.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Weaver Crest

classFeature.name: Silk Soar
entries: You have mastered the Clawline. You can now latch on to enemies and surfaces up to 30 feet away. Your bonus damage from your Clawline increases to 2d6.

As an Action, you can spend 1 Silk to launch your Needle vertically up to 150 feet. If your Needle makes contact with a surface or enemy, you can pull yourself up to your Needle as a Bonus Action. You can bring a number of allies with you equal to your Intelligence modifier. You can retract your Needle at any time while using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat (chapter 5 of the PHB) or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Elegy of the Deep
entries: You have developed a new use for your Needolin. You can spend 1 Silk Spool and a minute to cast the {@spell Dream} spell.

classFeature.name: Everbloom
entries: You have gained the means to resist dark forces. You now have advantage on Constitution saving throws; Fiends, Aberrations, and Undead have disadvantage on attacks against you; and you gain resistance to Necrotic damage.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an Epic Boon feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. Boon of Irresistable Offence is recommended.

classFeature.name: Sylphsong
entries: A benevolent being has taken up residence inside of you, empowering you with Silk. Whenever you take a Short or Long Rest, you regain all Silk Spools

subclassFeature.name: Architect's Bit
entries: You can now use a Spear, Lance, Trident, or Pike as your Needle. These weapons also count as Finesse weapons for you. You can now use the respective Weapon Mastery for these weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Level 3: Architect Crest
entries: {@i Use tools and gadgets to dominate}
You can equip a set number of Tools and Silk Skills for each subclass. Consult the table below to see what you can equip for subsequent levels. {@b This table includes Vesticrest Slots.}

subclassFeature.name: Level 6: Architect's Alchemy
entries: You've learned a unique way to Bind. As an Action, you can spend 5 Silk Spools to restore all uses of your equipped Red tools instead of healing. Once you use this ability, you must complete a Long Rest before using it again.

subclassFeature.name: Level 10: Needle Art
entries: Your mastery of the Needle allows you to attack decisively. As an Action, you can make a special Needle attack using a Polearm (Spear, Lance, Trident, or Pike):

entries.name: Drilling Strike
entries: As an Action, you can lunge forward with your Needle and attack all enemies in a 15-foot line. Make a separate attack roll for each creature. You add your proficiency bonus to the damage of each attack.
You can only gain 1 Silk Spool when using a Needle Art.

subclassFeature.name: Level 14: Crafting Savant
entries: You can use your Architect's Alchemy feature twice per Long Rest.
All of your Red Tools deal an additional die of damage (E.g. 2d4 > 3d4, 1d12 > 2d12)

subclassFeature.name: Beast's Claws
entries: You can use Unarmed Strikes as your Needle. Your Unarmed Strike die is now a {@dice d6} if it wasn't already, deals Slashing damage, and has the Finesse property. Furthermore, you can use the Graze weapon mastery as part of your Unarmed Strikes. Dealing damage through the Graze property does not restore Silk.
Binding now costs your Bonus Action instead of your Action.

subclassFeature.name: Level 3: Beast Crest
entries: {@i Rip and tear your foes to shreds}
You can equip a set number of Tools and Silk Skills for each subclass. Consult the table below to see what you can equip for subsequent levels. {@b This table includes Vesticrest Slots.}

subclassFeature.name: Level 6: Beast's Fury
entries: You Unarmed Strike die is now a {@dice d8}.
After you Bind, you enter a fury. You gain the following effects for your next 3 turns:

items: You can make an additional attack as part of the Attack action
Your movement speed increases by 10 feet
You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws
Once per turn, you regain Hit Points equal to your Unarmed Strike die when you hit an enemy

subclassFeature.name: Level 10: Needle Art
entries: Your Unarmed Strike die is now a {@dice d10}.
Your mastery of the Needle allows you to attack decisively. As an Action, you can make a special Needle attack using your Unarmed Strikes:

entries.name: Slashing Flurry
entries: As an Action, you can leap 10 feet and make 2 attacks with your Needle against enemies up to 10 feet away from you. Add your proficiency bonus to the damage of each attack. While your Fury is active, you can instead make 3 attacks.
You can only gain 1 Silk Spool when using a Needle Art.

subclassFeature.name: Level 14: Honed Claws
entries: Your Unarmed Strike die is now {@dice 2d6}. You also have advantage on the first attack you make during your Beast's Fury on each of your turns.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter's Blade
entries: You gain proficiency in Longswords which count as Finesse weapons for you, and can use the Sap mastery while using your Needle.

subclassFeature.name: Level 3: Hunter Crest
entries: {@i Build focus and cut your foes}
You can equip a set number of Tools and Silk Skills for each subclass. Consult the table below to see what you can equip for subsequent levels. {@b This table includes Vesticrest Slots.}

subclassFeature.name: Level 6: Hunter's Focus
entries: Each time you hit a hostile creature with your Needle, your Needle's damage increases by +1 to a maximum of +3. The damage bonus resets to 0 if you take damage from any source or take a Short or Long Rest.

subclassFeature.name: Level 10: Needle Art
entries: Your mastery of the Needle allows you to attack decisively. As an Action, you can make a special Needle attack using a Longsword:

entries.name: Double Slash
entries: As an Action, you can make two attacks against an enemy in your Needle's range. You have advantage on the attacks and you add your proficiency bonus to the damage.
You generate 1 Silk Spool for each attack that lands.

subclassFeature.name: Level 14: Deepened Focus
entries: The bonus damage from your *Hunter's Focus* feature now increases by +2 per attack that hits up to a maximum of +6.

subclassFeature.name: Level 3: Reaper Crest
entries: {@i Swing wide and generate Silk}
You can equip a set number of Tools and Silk Skills for each subclass. Consult the table below to see what you can equip for subsequent levels. {@b This table includes Vesticrest Slots.}

subclassFeature.name: Reaper's Scythe
entries: You gain proficiency in Glaives and Greataxes, and you can use your Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage modifiers. You can also use the Cleave mastery when using your Needle. You gain Silk as normal on the Cleave attack.
When you make a weapon your Needle, it gains the Reach property if it did not have it already.

subclassFeature.name: Level 6: Reaper's Harvest
entries: After you Bind, all attacks generate 2 Silk Spools instead of 1. This effect lasts for your next 3 turns.

subclassFeature.name: Level 10: Needle Art
entries: Your mastery of the Needle allows you to attack decisively. As an Action, you can make a special Needle attack using a Glaive or Greataxe:

entries.name: Great Slash
entries: Make an attack roll against all enemies within 15-foot cube in your Needle's range. You can add your ability modifier and proficiency bonus to the damage of these attacks.
You can only gain 1 Silk Spool when using a Needle Art. If your *Reaper's Harvest* ability is active, you gain 2 Silk Spools instead.

subclassFeature.name: Level 14: Bountiful Harvest
entries: You can now Cleave an additional enemy as a part of the Attack action. Additionally, all Cleave attacks generate Silk as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Level 3: Shaman Crest
entries: {@i Display your mastery of Silk Skills}
You can equip a set number of Tools and Silk Skills for each subclass. Consult the table below to see what you can equip for subsequent levels. {@b This table includes Vesticrest Slots.}

subclassFeature.name: Shaman's Slice
entries: You learn the Magic Needle cantrip. You can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action with this cantrip. You do not gain Silk Spools from the bonus damage to a second enemy.

entries.name: Magic Needle
entries: {@b Casting Time:} Action
{@b Range:} Self
{@b Components:} S, M (a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp)
{@b Duration:} Instantaneous

You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and you can cause magic to arc from the target to a different creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The second creature takes Force damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@dice 1d8} Force damage to the target on a hit, and the Force damage to the second creature increases to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by 1d8 at 11th level ({@dice 2d8} and {@dice 2d8}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d8} and {@dice 3d8}).
Additionally, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the damage of your Silk Skills.

subclassFeature.name: Level 6: Soul and Silk
entries: Your Silk Skills deal 1 additional die of damage.

subclassFeature.name: Level 10: Needle Art
entries: Your mastery of the Needle allows you to attack decisively. As an Action, you can make a special Needle attack:

entries.name: Shockwave
entries: You send out a blast of arcane energy from your Needle. Each enemy within a 15-foot Cube originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw against your Silk save DC. On a failure, the target takes Thunder damage equal to {@dice 3d8} + your Silk Skills modifier or half on a success.
Dealing damage with this Needle Art only generates 1 Silk Spool.

subclassFeature.name: Level 14: Call of the Abyss
entries: Your Silk Skills now deal 2 additional dice of damage.

subclassFeature.name: Level 3: Wanderer Crest
entries: {@i Outmaneuver your foes with speedy strikes}
You can equip a set number of Tools and Silk Skills for each subclass. Consult the table below to see what you can equip for subsequent levels. {@b This table includes Vesticrest Slots.}

subclassFeature.name: Wanderer's Blitz
entries: All Light weapons you are proficient with gain the Nick weapon mastery, and you can use the Nick weapon mastery even if you are not wielding two Light weapons. Additionally, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the Nick attack and generate Silk as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Level 6: Wanderer's Luck
entries: While you have 5 or more Silk Spools, you can score a Critical Hit on an attack roll of 19 or 20 on a {@dice d20}. This effect stacks with the Magnetite Dice tool.

subclassFeature.name: Level 10: Needle Art
entries: Your mastery of the Needle allows you to attack decisively. As an Action, you can make a special Needle attack using a Light weapon:

entries.name: Stabbing Flurry
entries: As an Action, you can make 3 attacks against an enemy within your Needle's reach. You have advantage on these attacks.
You can only gain 1 Silk Spool when using a Needle Art.

subclassFeature.name: Level 14: Supreme Luck
entries: While you have 5 or more Silk Spools, you can score a Critical Hit on an attack roll of 18-20 on a {@dice d20}. This effect stacks with the Magenetite Dice.

subclassFeature.name: Level 3: Witch Crest
entries: {@i Siphon life and Silk from your enemies}
You can equip a set number of Tools and Silk Skills for each subclass. Consult the table below to see what you can equip for subsequent levels. {@b This table includes Vesticrest Slots.}

subclassFeature.name: Witch's Whip
entries: You can use the Slow weapon mastery on Whips. Additionally, Whips now deal {@dice 1d6} Slashing damage.
Binding now costs your Bonus Action instead of your Action.

subclassFeature.name: Level 6: Witch's Curse
entries: You learn a special way to Bind. You can modify your Bind to no longer restore Hit Points as normal. Instead, any creature within a 15-foot Emanation must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@dice 2d10} + your Weaver level in Slashing damage. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage.
If you damage a creature with this feature, you recover Hit Points equal to half the damage dealt to one creature.

subclassFeature.name: Level 10: Needle Art
entries: Your mastery of the Needle allows you to attack decisively. As an Action, you can make a special Needle attack using a Whip:

entries.name: Cyclone
entries: As an Action, you can lash out and attack all enemies in your Needle's reach. Add your proficiency bonus to the damage of each attack.
As a Bonus Action, you can extend the duration of the attack and deal an additional {@dice 1d4} damage to each enemy you hit
You can only gain 1 Silk Spool when using a Needle Art.

subclassFeature.name: Level 14: Siphoning Curse
entries: When extending your Cyclone attack with your Bonus Action, the {@dice 1d4} of additional damage increases to {@dice 2d4}.

Additionally, the damage of your Witch's Curse feature increases by {@dice 1d10}, and you can restore Hit Points in addition to your Bind equal to your Silk modifier when an enemy fails their saving throw. These bonus Hit Points can only be earned once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Ascendant's Grip
entries: So long as you have this Tool equipped, you are under the effects of the {@spell Spider Climb} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Barbed Bracelet
entries: While this tool is equipped, you are vulnerable to all incoming damage, but you can add your Silk modifier to all damage that you deal. This effect stacks with the Shaman's Slice feature.

optionalfeature.name: Claw Mirrors
entries: When you Bind, you unleash a blast of blinding light around you. Each enemy creature within a 15-foot Emanation must make a Constitution saving throw against your Silk modifier or take {@dice 2d8} Radiant damage and be Blinded until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, the target creature takes half damage only.
When you reach Level 15, this Tool deals an additional {@dice 2d8} Necrotic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Cogfly
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can activate a miniature companion. Each Cogfly lasts for 5 rounds and deals {@dice 1d4} Bludgeoning damage by ramming an enemy of your choice within 20 feet of you at the start of your turn.
You can have a maximum of 4 active Cogflies at once.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 6 uses. Increases at Level 11 (7), and Level 17 (8).

optionalfeature.name: Cogwork Wheel
entries: Once per turn, you can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to release a Cogwork Wheel. Each enemy creature in a 30-foot Line must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Silk save DC, taking {@dice 3d6} Slashing damage on a failed save or half on a successful one.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 7 uses. Increases at Level 11 (8), and Level 17 (10).

optionalfeature.name: Compass
entries: You cannot become lost by non-magical means. You always know which way is North and the time of day. You can pinpoint your exact location if it is represented on a map you are viewing.

optionalfeature.name: Conchcutter
entries: Once per turn, you can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to fire a Conchutter in a 90-foot Line. This Line must be diagonal and bounces off of walls. Enemy creatures must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Silk save DC or take {@dice 2d6} + your Silk modifier in Piercing damage.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 12 uses. Increases at Level 11 (14), and Level 17 (16).

optionalfeature.name: Cross Stitch
entries: {@i Cost: 4 Silk Spools}

As a Reaction when an enemy attacks you with a Melee attack, you can add your Silk modifier to your Armor Class for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss. If the attack misses you, you can make a counterattack using your Silk modifier. On a hit, you deal {@dice 3d10} of your Needle's damage type to the attacking creature. This damage increases at Levels 7 ({@dice 4d10}), 11 ({@dice 5d10}), and 15 ({@dice 6d10}). You do not gain Silk on this attack.

optionalfeature.name: Curveclaw
entries: You can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to throw a Curveclaw. You throw the Curveclaw 15 feet forward before it rises 5 feet and travels 15 feet towards you. Creatures in the Curveclaw's path must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Silk save DC or take {@dice 2d4} Slashing damage for every 5 feet the Curveclaw travels over their current position.
At Level 15, this damage becomes {@dice 4d4} Slashing damage.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 10 uses. Increases at Level 5 (12), Level 11 (14), and Level 17 (16).

optionalfeature.name: Dead Bug's Purse
entries: You can craft a Bag of Holding. Your carrying capacity also increases by 50%.

optionalfeature.name: Delver's Drill
entries: After using the movement provided by your Drifter's Cloak or Faydown Cloak, you can move up to 30 feet straight down to make an attack using your Dexterity modifier against an enemy directly below you. This attack replaces one of your attacks as part of the Attack action. You do not suffer any fall damage as a result of this attack, and this attack does not restore any Silk.
A creature hit by this drill takes 2d6 Piercing damage and you add your ability modifier to the damage.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 13 uses. Increases at Level 11 (15), and Level 17 (18).

optionalfeature.name: Druid's Eyes
entries: As a Reaction when you take damage, you gain 1 Silk Spool. You can use the Memory Crystal with the same Reaction.
Starting at Level 11, you instead regain 2 Silk Spools.

optionalfeature.name: Egg of Flealia
entries: The cost of your Silk Skills is reduced by 1 Silk Spool while you are not Bloodied.

optionalfeature.name: Flea Brew
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can drink a special concoction called Flea Brew. Drinking Flea Brew increases your movement speed by 5 feet and allows you to make one additional attack as part of the Attack action. This effect lasts for 2 turns.
This effect does not stack with the Beast's Fury feature.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 4 uses. Increases at Level 11 (5), and Level 17 (6).

optionalfeature.name: Flintslate
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can scrape your Needle against the Flintslate causing it to heat up. Until the end of your next turn, you deal an additional 1d6 Fire damage to enemies you hit with your Needle.
If you have the Pollip Pouch equipped, you deal an additional {@dice 1d4} Poison damage until the effect ends and enemies must make the Constitution saving throw from the Pollip Pouch.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 4 uses. Increases at Level 11 (5), and Level 17 (6).

optionalfeature.name: Fractured Mask
entries: The first time you take damage and would be reduced to 0 Hit Points but not killed outright, the mask is damaged and you are reduced to 1 hitpoint instead. This feature cannot be used again until the mask is repaired during a Long Rest.

optionalfeature.name: Injector Band
entries: Binding now only takes a Bonus Action.
When equipped on Witch Crest or Beast Crest, binding can be done as a free action, though only once per turn.
When combined with Multibinder, Binding takes an Action (or a Bonus Action on Witch Crest and Beast Crest).

optionalfeature.name: Longclaw
entries: Increases the range of your Needle attacks and Needle Art attacks by 5 feet. The dimensions of the area of effect for the Reaper and Shaman Crests' Nail Arts also increase by 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Longpin
entries: You can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to make an attack with a Longpin. This Tool ignores resistance to Piercing damage.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Finesse, Thrown (Range 40/120)

entries.name: Damage Die
entries: {@dice 1d8) Piercing

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 12 uses. Increases at Level 5 (15), Level 11 (17), and Level 17 (20).

optionalfeature.name: Magma Bell
entries: You gain resistance to Fire damage. You are also immune to the {@spell Heat Metal} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetite Brooch
entries: Any time you encounter a dead creature, you are immediately aware of anything of value they have on their corpse. You also have advantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks to pickpocket others.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetite Dice
entries: Equipping these makes you exceedingly lucky and hard to hit. If you are not using a Shield, your Armor Class increases by 2.
If equipped on the Wanderer Crest, the number required to land a Critical Hit is reduced by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Memory Crystal
entries: When taking damage, you can use your Reaction to eject hardened Silk at enemies. Each enemy creature within 5 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw or take Piercing damage equal to {@dice 2d6} + your Silk modifier. You can use the Druid's Eyes with the same Reaction.
The damage die for this Tool increases at Level 11 ({@dice 3d6}) and Level 17 ({@dice 4d6}).

optionalfeature.name: Multibinder
entries: Binding now requires your Action and Bonus Action to complete (or your Action only on Witch Crest and Beast Crest). However, you heal an additional 1d10 Hit Points when you Bind.
When equipped on Witch Crest, your Witch's Curse feature deals an additional 1d10 Slashing damage.
When combined with Injector Band, you can Bind as normal while still receiving the additional healing.

optionalfeature.name: Pale Nails
entries: {@i Cost: 7 Silk Spools}

As a Magic action, you summon 3 pale, spectral nails that home in on your targets. Choose up to three targets within 60 feet and make an attack roll for each Pale Nail using your Silk modifier. On a hit, a Pail Nail deals {@dice 6d4} Radiant damage. This damage increases to {@dice 7d4} at Level 15.

optionalfeature.name: Pimpillo
entries: Once per turn, you can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to throw a Pimpillo up to 30 feet. Enemy creatures within a 15-foot sphere of a Pimpillo must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Silk modifier. On a failure, a target takes {@dice 3d6} Fire damage. On a successful save, the target only takes half damage.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 6 uses. Increases at Level 11 (7), and Level 17 (8).

optionalfeature.name: Pin Badge
entries: Your Needle Art attacks no longer require your entire Action and can instead be made as part of the Attack action, but only once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Plasmium Phial
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can inject yourself with the Plasmium Phial to give yourself {@dice 1d10} + your Proficiency Bonus in Temporary Hit Points. Temporary Hit Points gained this way can stack, though they do not stack with other features that provide Temporary Hit Points.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 4 uses. Increases at Level 11 (5), and Level 17 (6).

optionalfeature.name: Pollip Pouch
entries: When you damage a creature with a Red Tool, they take an additional {@dice 1d4} Poison damage and must make a Constitution saving throw against your Silk Save DC. On a failed save, the creature has the Poisoned condition for 1 minute. While Poisoned this way, the target takes {@dice 1d4} Poison damage at the start of their turn.
At the end of each of its turns, the Poisoned target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Sling
entries: You can now use twice as many Red Tools per Action, Bonus Action, or Reaction.
This does not affect Silkshot, Delver's Drill, Rosary Cannon, Flintslate, Snare Setter, Flea Brew, or Plasmium Phial.

optionalfeature.name: Reserve Bind
entries: You can Bind or use a special Bind from your Crest without expending any Silk once per Short Rest.

optionalfeature.name: Rosary Cannon
entries: As an Action, you can fire 8 bullets from this device at any enemies within 45 feet of you if they are not behind half, three-quarters, or full cover. Each bullet deals Bludgeoning damage equal to 1 + your Silk modifier and costs 1 Gold to fire. This damage cannot be stopped except by the {@spell Shield} spell.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 10 uses (80 bullets). Can only be reloaded during a Long Rest, and cannot be reloaded using the *Architect's Alchemy* feature.

optionalfeature.name: Rune Rage
entries: {@i Cost: 7 Silk Spools}

As a Magic action, you spawn a 20-foot Sphere of silken runes within 60 feet of you. Each creature in the Sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 8d6} Radiant damage as the runes detonate. A creature only takes half damage on a successful saving throw. This damage increases to {@dice 10d6} at Level 15.

optionalfeature.name: Sawtooth Circlet
entries: When you use your Swift Step, Faydown Cloak, or Drifter's Cloak abilities during your turn, you can deal {@dice 1d4} damage to any enemies you pass within 5 feet of (no Action required).

optionalfeature.name: Scuttlebrace
entries: You can now Dash and Disengage as a Bonus Action, and as part of the same Bonus Action.

optionalfeature.name: Shard Pendant
entries: During a Short Rest, you can restore 50% of the uses of your currently equipped Red Tools (round down). Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you take a Long Rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sharpdart
entries: {@i Cost: 4 Silk Spools}

As a Magic action, you can dash through enemies in a 25-foot Line without taking opportunity attacks. Each enemy creature in the Line must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 4d6} Slashing damage or half on a success. This damage increases at Levels 7 ({@dice 5d6}), 11 ({@dice 6d6}), and 15 ({@dice 7d6}).
If the dash finishes with you occupying the same space as another creature, you take 1d8 Force damage and are shunted to the nearest open space.

optionalfeature.name: Shell Satchel
entries: Your maximum number of Red Tool uses increases by 25% (minimum of 1, round down). Does not apply to Rosary Cannon.

optionalfeature.name: Silk Spear
entries: {@i Cost: 4 Silk Spools}

As a Magic action, you unleash a dart of silken energy in a 5-foot wide, 20-foot long Line. All creatures in the Line must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 3d8} Piercing damage or half on a success. This damage increases by {@dice 1d8} at Levels 7 ({@dice 4d8}), 11 ({@dice 5d8}), and 15 ({@dice 6d8}).

optionalfeature.name: Silkshot (Forge Daughter)
entries: You can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to fire the Silkshot. Each shot consumes 1 Silk.
Additionally, you use your Silk modifier for the to hit and damage values when using this Tool.
You may only have one Silkshot variant equipped at a time.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Ammunition (Range 40/120), Heavy, Two-Handed

entries.name: Damage Die
entries: {@dice 1d12) Thunder

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 21 uses. Increases at Level 17 (24).

optionalfeature.name: Silkshot (Twelfth Architect)
entries: You can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to fire the Silkshot. Each shot consumes 1 Silk.

Enemy creatures in a 20-foot Cone must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Silk save DC or take Thunder damage equal to 2d6 + your Silk modifier. On a successful save, a target takes half damage.
You may only have one Silkshot variant equipped at a time.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 13 uses. Increases at Level 17 (15).

optionalfeature.name: Silkshot (Weavenest)
entries: You can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to fire the Silkshot. Each shot consumes 1 Silk.

Enemy creatures in a 30-foot Line must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Silk modifier or take Thunder damage equal to 3d4 + your Silk save DC. On a successful save, a target takes half damage.
You may only have one Silkshot variant equipped at a time.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 14 uses. Increases at Level 17 (16).

optionalfeature.name: Silkspeed Anklets
entries: When you Dash, you can spend 1 Silk to triple your movement speed rather than double it.
The distance you can rush with your Swift Step feature is doubled to 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Snare Setter
entries: As an Action and for 1 Silk Spool, you can set a trap of woven Silk. Any enemy creature that steps within 15 feet of the Snare Setter activates the trap and must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Silk save DC. On a failed save, the target takes {@dice 4d8} Radiant damage and is Restrained until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, the target only takes half damage.
You can have up to 4 traps set in this manner. If you attempt to set a 5th trap, the first one you set disappates.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 7 uses. Increases at Level 11 (8) and Level 17 (10).

optionalfeature.name: Snitch Pick
entries: You deal an additional {@dice 1d6} of your Needle's damage when you use your Clawline. You also generate an additional Silk Spool when you use your Clawline.

optionalfeature.name: Spider Strings
entries: The range of your Needolin abilities increases by 30 feet. You may also target an additional creature with your Needolin abilities.

optionalfeature.name: Spool Extender
entries: Your maximum number of Silk Spools increases by 3.

optionalfeature.name: Sting Shard
entries: Once per turn, you can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to throw a Sting Shard up to 20 feet. Sting Shards last until the end of your next turn. Any enemy creature that moves within or is within 5 feet of a Sting Shard when it lands must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Silk save DC or take {@dice 2d8} Piercing damage. A creature only takes half damage on a successful save.
The damage die for this Tool increases to {@dice 4d8} at Level 11.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 7 uses. Increases at Level 5 (9), Level 11 (10), and Level 17 (12).

optionalfeature.name: Straight Pin
entries: You can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to make an attack with a Straight Pin.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Finesse, Thrown (Range 60/180), Light

entries.name: Damage Die
entries: {@dice 1d6) Slashing

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 15 uses. Increases at Level 5 (18), Level 11 (21), and Level 17 (24).

optionalfeature.name: Tacks
entries: Once per turn, you can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to throw Tacks up to 30 feet. These Tacks land on the ground and spread out in a 15-foot Emanation. Tacks last until the end of your next turn.
When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes {@dice 2d4} Piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 7 uses. Increases at Level 11 (8), and Level 17 (10).

optionalfeature.name: Thief's Mark
entries: You have a cipher for Thieves' Cant. Additionally, Thieves' Guilds consider you an ally while wearing this.
You earn 10% more currency when selling magical and nonmagical items, but buying items costs 10% more.

optionalfeature.name: Thread Storm
entries: {@i Cost: 4 Silk Spools}

As a Magic action, silk flares out from within you, lashing out at enemies around you in a 10-foot Emanation. All enemy creatures must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d8 Slashing damage or half on a success. This damage increases at Levels 7 ({@dice 3d8}), 11 ({@dice 4d8}), and 15 ({@dice 5d8}).
You can use your Bonus Action to deal an additional {@dice 2d4} Slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Threefold Pin
entries: You can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to throw a Threefold Pin. Choose up to 3 creatures within a 15-foot Cone. Each creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Silk save DC, taking {@dice 3d4} Piercing damage on a failed save or half as much on a success.

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 15 uses. Increases at Level 11 (17), and Level 17 (20).

optionalfeature.name: Throwing Ring
entries: You can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to make an attack with a Throwing Ring.
If you roll a 4 on this Tool's damage die, the Throwing Ring bounces to another enemy within range. The Throwing Ring can bounce a number of times equal to your Silk modifier.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Finesse, Thrown (Range 40/120)

entries.name: Damage Die
entries: {@dice 2d4) Bludgeoning

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 15 uses. Increases at Level 11 (17) and Level 17 (20).

optionalfeature.name: Volt Filament
entries: All Silk Skills deal an additional 1d8 of Lightning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Voltvessel (Stake)
entries: Once per turn, you can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to throw a Voltvessel. This attack does not restore Silk.

Regardless of whether the Voltvessel hits its target, all creatures within a 15-foot-radius, 45-foot-high Cylinder centered on your original target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Silk save DC. On a failed save, each target takes {@dice 4d8} Lightning damage. On a successful save, a target only takes half damage.
You may only have one version of Voltvessel equipped at a time. This tool does not receive the benefits from equipping the Pollip Pouch.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Finesse, Thrown (Range 20/60)

entries.name: Damage Die
entries: {@dice 1d6) Piercing

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 8 uses. Increases at Level 17 (10).

optionalfeature.name: Voltvessel (Stake)
entries: Once per turn, you can replace one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to throw a Voltvessel. This attack does not restore Silk.

Regardless of whether the Voltvessel hits its target, all creatures within two 10-foot Spheres touching your original target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Silk save DC. On a failed save, each target takes {@dice 4d8} Lightning damage. On a successful save, a target only takes half damage. A creature cannot take damage from both Spheres.
You may only have one version of Voltvessel equipped at a time. This tool does not receive the benefits from equipping the Pollip Pouch.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Finesse, Thrown (Range 20/60)

entries.name: Damage Die
entries: {@dice 1d4) Bludgeoning

entries.name: Uses per Long Rest
entries: 8 uses. Increases at Level 17 (10).

optionalfeature.name: Warding Bell
entries: After Binding, you gain a protective ward that lasts until the start of your next turn or until you take damage. The first time you take damage with this ward active, you can reduce the incoming damage by 1d10 + your Weaver level. The ward is then destroyed.
If the enemy that hit your ward is within 5 feet of you, that enemy also takes Radiant damage equal to your Silk modifier.
You can still use the Memory Crystal and Druid's Eyes even if you reduce the damage to 0.

optionalfeature.name: Weavelight
entries: You can now generate Silk Hearts even faster. If you have fewer Silk Spools than Silk Hearts at the start of your turn, you gain 2 Silk Spools instead of 1 up to your maximum number of Silk Hearts.
Additionally, your maximum Silk Hearts is increased by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Weighted Belt
entries: As long as you are not Incapacitated, you cannot be forcibly moved or knocked prone against your will.

optionalfeature.name: Wispfire
entries: At the start of your turn, you lose 1 Silk Spool and magically summon a Wispfire. You can only have 1 Wispfire summoned at a time.

Whenever you see a hostile creature within 30 feet of you, the Wispfire will immediately fly into the creature and detonate dealing Fire damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Silk modifier. This damage is automatic unless the {@spell Shield} spell is cast.

optionalfeature.name: Wreath of Purity
entries: This item has 6 charges. When an enemy or hazard attempts to curse you or deal Poison damage to you, you can expend 1 charge of this item to negate the effect or gain resistance to the Poison damage. You regain all charges on this item when you finish a Short or Long rest.
